text: Something really needs to be done about nesting pages within the CMS, right now, relying on the content editors to always have to type in a correct url when creating pages. Is there a way to do something like in WP where there is a dropdown of "Parent Page" so it's easier to  create that hierarchy. Also, please bring back tree view

It would be really nice if there was a general "get posts" function that accepted arguments like number of posts, offset, tags, author, post date, and so on, instead of having to rely on blog_recent_topic_posts and blog_recent_author_posts, which are both limiting and don't allow you to easily filter by multiple factors at once

If I want to filter by 2 tags at once, the best I can do is call blog_recent_topic_posts twice and (if I want all posts in both lists) combine the lists, filter out repeats, and re-sort by publish date or (if I want only posts that have both tags), loop through the posts and and only print the ones that appear in both lists.
It's just a pretty clumsy dev experience. In Wordpress, it would be pretty easy; I just need to know the right syntax for the arguments in `get_posts`.
:bulb: add an image gallery column type to hubdb that would return an array of image objects. Would prevent having to create a dozen or more image columns for simple galleries.

I would love to see more emphasis overall, but also specifically in the default HubSpot DM modules, put on accessibility compliance. We have some clients in highly regulated industries whose sites have to get as close to meeting those WCAG standards as possible, but things like icons in default modules w/no aria roles and that kind of thing make preventive audits a much more time consuming process.
my arguement - if someone can produce high quality accessible modules thereâ€™s a great opportunity for them on the marketplace :wink:

agree, but I also think they definetly should improve the defaults :slightly_smiling_face:
and those span tags as wrappers kill me tooxD
yea, gonna have to agree with that span tag issue for sure
they should have remove that at least for the DM2
